* Contact: ActiuInformatica
* Brand: Olidata
* Model: GREEN220 / Tehom CW 1300 CRTA
* Product website: http://www.olidata.com/

* Detect integrated Webcam.
* AC'97 Modem as /dev/modem
* Reading the battery state and level.
* Light Wireless button led.

=== (*) Notes and recipes ===

==== Image seen on screen ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Cannot switch to text-only screen/console (Ctrl+Alt+F1), screen shows blank. This happened when booted with external monitor connected; I don't know if this was the problem.

==== Correct resolution ====
The 1280x800 LCD resolution in a so small LCD (11.5") causes the desktop elements to be shown so small. If you reduce the resolution (for example to 1024x768), the image doesn't fit correctly in the LCD pixels array. This is a hardware issue, not specific to any software.

==== Battery detected ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Only detects the presence of a battery, but doesn't read the state nor charge.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): Only detects the presence of a battery, but doesn't read the state nor charge.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Only detects the presence of a battery, but doesn't read the state nor charge.

==== Suspends ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): In Live-CD cannot wakeup after.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): In Live-CD cannot wakeup after.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): In Live-CD cannot wakeup after.

==== Correct volume ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Too slow on speakers.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): Too slow on speakers.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Too slow on speakers.

==== Wireless NIC ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): hardware led doesn't light, but the same hardware button works. If you see the wireless device disabled, push this button and will enable.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): hardware led doesn't light, but the same hardware button works. If you see the wireless device disabled, push this button and will enable.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): hardware led doesn't light, but the same hardware button works. If you see the wireless device disabled, push this button and will enable.

==== Mic jack ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Volume too slow.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): Volume too slow.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Volume too slow; Need to select "Intel 82801DB-ICH4" input device (Ekiga)

==== Videocamera ====
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon): Integrated Webcam presence is not detected at all.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.04 (Hardy Heron): Integrated Webcam presence is not detected at all.
* Ubuntu GNU/Linux 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex): Integrated Webcam presence is not detected at all.
